Posts.Content: Hi Deb42...like the others have said it is normal to have worries and be scared about surgery. I know I felt the same before my op back in June. In the ward I was in I had two lovely ladies who had theirs the day before me and they were great at chatting to me and kept my mind off what I was waiting for. Have a chat with some of the nurses and they might give you something just to keep you calm :-) will be thinking about you tomorrow xxx vanda
Posts.Title: Still very anxious about surgery tommorow

Posts.Content: Hi Abbey, Just wanted to wish you all the best for today and your first bout of chemo. Also i just wanted to say I know I dont know and we have never met, but, I am so proud of how you seem to have got the fight in you now to kick this damn "c" :-) i read your posts from the weekend and you sounded really low. I think you are going to be a Tigger, like me:-) keep bouncing!!! Vanda xx
Posts.Title: 1st chemo today...today I start fighting back!

Posts.Content: Hi ladies....im totally disgusted and annoyed at the photo i saw of mel b!!! Id a bilateral mastectomy at the end of june and would give anything to have my boobs back! How dare she flaunt what she has to us ladies who have lost part, one or both of ours!!! I would like to know who thought that this kind of photo could promote breast cancer awareness. Can anyone share the link with me cause i would like to put it onto mu fb page!! Big hugs to all the lovely ladies on here xxx vanda
Posts.Title: Mel B´s "campaign"

Posts.Content: Hi Louise...i was diagnosed with bc in june, had bilateral mastectomy and because mine had spread to my bones I was told I was having hormone treatment. I am 46, so like you hadnt been through menopause. Im getting Zoladex injections every 28days plus on Letrozole tabs daily. Hot flushes are a bugger but what can you do...Im due to go for my first scan, since starting my treatment, on the 19th and following week go back for results and dreading it. I was told I wouldnt be getting chemo or rads atm. Wishing you all the best xx
Posts.Title: Has anyone been brought into early menopause by injection.

Posts.Content: Hi Strongwilled....well done you that is a fantastic amount to raise and you deserve to share that :-) Im having mine tomorrow morning and I have already received £180 in donations. Knackered tonight after baking the past two days but I enjoyed it :-) Again well done...be proud :-) xx Vanda
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee morning - £670.50!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, can anyone tell me what you are and arent allowed to use regards deodorants, shower gels etc? I just had double mastectomy and lymph mode clearance, but unfortunately the cancer has spread into my spine. I have started hormone treatment, had my first injection and start my tablets in a few weeks. Soo many questions to ask and unless i write them down i forget by the time i go to see my bc nurse lol... I havent posted alot on here but im on nearly everyday reading everyone elses posts and i agree with so many that you have to try and keep a positive mental attitude but its not always easy!!! Whenever i waken during the night and cant get back to sleep, thats when my mind thinks all sorts ie how will my partner manage without me and my 8yr old daughter and my 2 sons!! Sorry for ranting...i only came on to ask about scented stuff lol... Hugs to you all from.....Tigger (aka Vanda) xx
Posts.Title: Smelly stuff

Posts.Content: Hi Shaz, I'm on Goserelin injections too. I get one every month into my abdomen, time about on either side, the nurse freezes the area first with some kind of spray. I would check with your Bcn and see what she has to say. I hope this has helped your querie. Take care Vanda x
Posts.Title: Zoladex.. Advice needed

Posts.Content: Hi DaisyMe...havent been on for a few days, need a rota for the laptop!!  Started my hormone treatment on Wed, had my first injection and then wait 4wks and start on tablets too. Definately not looking forward to the "hot-flushes" lol but what can you do :-)  hope all is well with you
Posts.Title: new and scared...

Posts.Content: Hi Beevergirl, I am getting Zoladex injection monthly, then in 4wks time i start on tablets too. I have Ibandronic acid, Letrozole & Natecal D3..im definately going to buy a lady care magnetic bracelet too as im starting to get that inner glowing feeling lol. Nothing to do with the weather as its not just as warm where i am, which is Northern Ireland. Though the sun is trying its best to get out here!! Hope all is good with you and thanx for your wee message Vanda xx
Posts.Title: new and scared...

Posts.Content: Hi DaisyMe, I noticed you have secondary breast caner in your bones like I have...I just found out I had breast cancer on the 11th june, then on 9th july i found out it had spread to my bones, into my spine. I dont know how you are feeling but when I was told that news I thought I was going to pass out with the shock. Reading on the net about secondary bone cancer is scary..but Im not going to give up yet and hope you are going to fight it too!!!
Posts.Title: new and scared...
